0.speaker: RADDATZ:
0.text: Tonight's debate is divided between domestic and foreign policy issues. And I'm going to move back and forth between foreign and domestic, since that is what a vice president or president would have to do. We will have nine different segments. At the beginning of each segment, I will ask both candidates a question, and they will each have two minutes to answer. Then I will encourage a discussion between the candidates with follow-up questions.
0.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

1.speaker: RADDATZ:
1.text: By coin toss, it has been determined that Vice President Biden will be first to answer the opening question. We have a wonderful audience here at Centre College tonight. You will no doubt hear their enthusiasm at the end of the debate — and right now, as we welcome Vice President Joe Biden and Congressman Paul Ryan. [
1.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

2.speaker: RADDATZ:
2.text: OK, you got your little wave to the families in. It's great. Good evening, gentlemen. It really is an honor to be here with both of you.
2.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

3.speaker: RADDATZ:
3.text: I would like to begin with Libya. On a rather somber note, one month ago tonight, on the anniversary of 9/11, Ambassador Chris Stevens and three other brave Americans were killed in a terrorist attack in Benghazi. The State Department has now made clear, there were no protesters there.
3.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

4.speaker: RADDATZ:
4.text: it was a pre-planned assault by heavily armed men. Wasn't this a massive intelligence failure, Vice President Biden?
4.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

5.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT JOSEPH BIDEN:
5.text: What is was, it was a tragedy, Martha. It — Chris Stevens was one of our best. We lost three other brave Americans.
5.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

6.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT JOSEPH BIDEN:
6.text: I can make absolutely two commitments to you and all the American people tonight. One, we will find and bring to justice the men who did this. And secondly, we will get to the bottom of it, and whatever — wherever the facts lead us, wherever they lead us, we will make clear to the American public, because whatever mistakes were made will not be made again.
6.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

7.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT JOSEPH BIDEN:
7.text: When you're looking at a president, Martha, it seems to me that you should take a look at his most important responsibility. That's caring for the national security of the country. And the best way to do that is take a look at how he's handled the issues of the day.
7.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

8.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT JOSEPH BIDEN:
8.text: On Iraq, the president said he would end the war. Governor Romney said that was a tragic mistake, we should have left 30,000 — he ended it. Governor Romney said that was a tragic mistake, we should have left 30,000 troops there.
8.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

9.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT JOSEPH BIDEN:
9.text: With regard to Afghanistan, he said he will end the war in 2014. Governor Romney said we should not set a date, number one. And number two, with regard to 2014, it depends.
9.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

10.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT JOSEPH BIDEN:
10.text: When it came to Osama bin Laden, the president the first day in office, I was sitting with him in the Oval Office, he called in the CIA and signed an order saying, "My highest priority is to get bin Laden."
10.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

11.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT JOSEPH BIDEN:
11.text: Prior to the election, prior to the — him being sworn in, Governor Romney was asked the question about how he would proceed. He said, "I wouldn't move heaven and earth to get bin Laden." He didn't understand it was more than about taking a murderer off the battlefield. It was about restoring America's heart and letting terrorists around the world know, if you do harm to America, we will track you to the gates of hell if need be.
11.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

12.speaker: VICE PRESIDENT JOSEPH BIDEN:
12.text: And lastly, the president of the United States has — has led with a steady hand and clear vision. Governor Romney, the opposite. The last thing we need now is another war.
12.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

13.speaker: RADDATZ:
13.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

14.speaker: REPRESENTATIVE PAUL RYAN:
14.text: We mourn the loss of these four Americans who were murdered.
14.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

15.speaker: RYAN:
15.text: When you take a look at what has happened just in the last few weeks, they sent the U.N. ambassador out to say that this was because of a protest and a YouTube video. It took the president two weeks to acknowledge that this was a terrorist attack.
15.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

16.speaker: RYAN:
16.text: He went to the U.N. and in his speech at the U.N. he said six times — he talked about the YouTube video.
16.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

17.speaker: RYAN:
17.text: Look, if we're hit by terrorists we're going to call it for what it is, a terrorist attack. Our ambassador in Paris has a Marine detachment guarding him. Shouldn't we have a Marine detachment guarding our ambassador in Benghazi, a place where we knew that there was an Al Qaida cell with arms?
17.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

18.speaker: RYAN:
18.text: This is becoming more troubling by the day. They first blamed the YouTube video. Now they're trying to blame the Romney-Ryan ticket for making this an issue.
18.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

19.speaker: RYAN:
19.text: With respect to Iraq, we had the same position before the withdrawal, which was we agreed with the Obama administration. Let's have a status of forces agreement to make sure that we secure our gains. The vice president was put in charge of those negotiations by President Obama and they failed to get the agreement. We don't have a status of forces agreement because they failed to get one. That's what we are talking about.
19.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

20.speaker: RYAN:
20.text: Now, when it comes to our veterans, we owe them a great debt of gratitude for what they've done for us, including your son Beau. But we also want to make sure that we don't lose the things we fought so hard to get.
20.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

21.speaker: RYAN:
21.text: Now, with respect to Afghanistan, the 2014 deadline, we agree with a 2014 transition. But what we also want it do is make sure that we're not projecting weakness abroad, and that's what's happening here.
21.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

22.speaker: RYAN:
22.text: This Benghazi issue would be a tragedy in and of itself, but unfortunately it's indicative of a broader problem. And that is what we are watching on our TV screens is the unraveling of the Obama foreign policy, which is making the [
22.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

23.speaker: RADDATZ:
23.text: I just want to you about right in the middle of the crisis. Governor Romney, and you're talking about this again tonight, talked about the weakness; talked about apologies from the Obama administration. Was that really appropriate right in the middle of the crisis?
23.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

24.speaker: RYAN:
24.text: On that same day, the Obama administration had the exact same position. Let's recall that they disavowed their own statement that they had put out earlier in the day in Cairo. So we had the same position, but we will — it's never too early to speak out for our values.
24.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

25.speaker: RYAN:
25.text: We should have spoken out right away when the green revolution was up and starting; when the mullahs in Iran were attacking their people. We should not have called Bashar Assad a reformer when he was turning his Russian-provided guns on his own people. We should always stand up for peace, for democracy, for individual rights.
25.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

26.speaker: RYAN:
26.text: And we should not be imposing these devastating defense cuts, because what that does when we equivocate on our values, when we show that we're cutting down on defense, it makes us more weak. It projects weakness. And when we look weak, our adversaries are much more willing to test us. They're more brazen in their attacks, and are allies are less willing to...[
26.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

27.speaker: BIDEN:
27.text: With all due respect, that's a bunch of malarkey.
27.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

28.speaker: RADDATZ:
28.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

29.speaker: BIDEN:
29.text: Because not a single thing he said is accurate. First of all...
29.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

30.speaker: RADDATZ:
30.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

31.speaker: BIDEN:
31.text: I will be very specific. Number one, the — this lecture on embassy security — the congressman here cut embassy security in his budget by $300 million below what we asked for, number one. So much for the embassy security piece.
31.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

32.speaker: BIDEN:
32.text: Number two, Governor Romney, before he knew the facts, before he even knew that our ambassador was killed, he was out making a political statement which was panned by the media around the world. And this talk about this — this weakness. I — I don't understand what my friend's talking about here.
32.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

33.speaker: BIDEN:
33.text: We — this is a president who's gone out and done everything he has said he was going to do. This is a guy who's repaired our alliances so the rest of the world follows us again. This is the guy who brought the entire world, including Russia and China, to bring about the most devastating — most devastating — the most devastating efforts on Iran to make sure that they in fact stop [
33.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

34.speaker: BIDEN:
34.text: Look, I — I just — I mean, these guys bet against America all the time.
34.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

35.speaker: RADDATZ:
35.text: Can we talk — let me go back to Libya.
35.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

36.speaker: BIDEN:
36.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

37.speaker: RADDATZ:
37.text: What were you first told about the attack? Why — why were people talking about protests? When people in the consulate first saw armed men attacking with guns, there were no protesters. Why did that go on [
37.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

38.speaker: BIDEN:
38.text: Because that was exactly what we were told by the intelligence community. The intelligence community told us that. As they learned more facts about exactly what happened, they changed their assessment. That's why there's also an investigation headed by Tom Pickering, a leading diplomat from the Reagan years, who is doing an investigation as to whether or not there are any lapses, what the lapses were, so that they will never happen again.
38.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

39.speaker: RADDATZ:
39.text: And they wanted more security there.
39.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

40.speaker: BIDEN:
40.text: Well, we weren't told they wanted more security there. We did not know they wanted more security again. And by the way, at the time we were told exactly — we said exactly what the intelligence community told us that they knew. That was the assessment. And as the intelligence community changed their view, we made it clear they changed their view.
40.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

41.speaker: BIDEN:
41.text: That's why I said we will get to the bottom of this. You know, usually when there's a crisis, we pull together. We pull together as a nation. But as I said, even before we knew what happened to the ambassador, the governor was holding a press conference — was holding a press conference. That's not presidential leadership.
41.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

42.speaker: RADDATZ:
42.text: Mr. Ryan, I want to ask you about — the Romney campaign talks a lot about no apologies. He has a book called called "No Apologies." Should the U.S. have apologized for Americans burning Korans in Afghanistan? Should the U.S. apologize for U.S. Marines urinating on Taliban corpses?
42.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

43.speaker: RYAN:
43.text: Oh, gosh, yes. Urinating on Taliban corpses? What we should not apologize for...
43.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

44.speaker: RADDATZ:
44.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

45.speaker: RYAN:
45.text: What — what we should not be apologizing for are standing up for our values. What we should not be doing is saying to the Egyptian people, while Mubarak is cracking down on them, that he's a good guy and, in the next week, say he ought to go.
45.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

46.speaker: RYAN:
46.text: What we should not be doing is rejecting claims for — for calls for more security in our barracks, in our Marine — we need Marines in Benghazi when the commander on the ground says we need more forces for security. There were requests for extra security; those requests were not honored.
46.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

47.speaker: RYAN:
47.text: Look, this was the anniversary of 9/11. It was Libya, a country we knew we had Al Qaida cells there, as we know Al Qaida and its affiliates are on the rise in Northern Africa. And we did not give our ambassador in Benghazi a Marine detachment?
47.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

48.speaker: RYAN:
48.text: Of course there's an investigation, so we can make sure that this never happens again, but when it comes to speaking up for our values, we should not apologize for those. Here's the problem. Look at all the various issues out there, and it's unraveling before our eyes. The vice president talks about sanctions on Iran. They got — we've had four...
48.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

49.speaker: RADDATZ:
49.text: Let's move to Iran. I'd actually like to move to Iran, because there's really no bigger national security...
49.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

50.speaker: RYAN:
50.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

51.speaker: RADDATZ:
51.text: ... this country is facing. Both President Obama and Governor Romney have said they will prevent Iran from getting a nuclear weapon, even if that means military action. Last week, former Defense Secretary Bob Gates said a strike on Iran's facilities would not work and, quote, "could prove catastrophic, haunting us for generations." Can the two of you be absolutely clear and specific to the American people how effective would a military strike be? Congressman Ryan?
51.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

52.speaker: RYAN:
52.text: We cannot allow Iran to gain a nuclear weapons capability. Now, let's take a look at where we've gone — come from. When Barack Obama was elected, they had enough fissile material — nuclear material to make one bomb. Now they have enough for five. They're racing toward a nuclear weapon. They're four years closer toward a nuclear weapons capability.
52.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

53.speaker: RYAN:
53.text: We've had four different sanctions, the U.N. on Iran, three from the Bush administration, one here. And the only reason we got it is because Russia watered it down and prevented the — the sanctions from hitting the central bank.
53.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

54.speaker: RYAN:
54.text: Mitt Romney proposed these sanctions in 2007. In Congress, I've been fighting for these sanctions since 2009. The administration was blocking us every step of the way. Only because we had strong bipartisan support for these tough sanctions were we able to overrule their objections and put them in spite of the administration.
54.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

55.speaker: RYAN:
55.text: Imagine what would have happened if we had these sanctions in place earlier. You think Iran's not brazen? Look at what they're doing. They're stepping up their terrorist attacks. They tried a terrorist attack in the United States last year when they tried to blow up the Saudi ambassador at a restaurant in Washington, D.C.
55.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

56.speaker: RYAN:
56.text: And talk about credibility? When this administration says that all options are on the table, they send out senior administration officials that send all these mixed signals.
56.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

57.speaker: RYAN:
57.text: And so, in order to solve this peacefully — which is everybody's goal — you have to have the ayatollahs change their minds. Look at where they are. They're moving faster toward a nuclear weapon. It's because this administration has no credibility on this issue. It's because this administration watered down sanctions, delayed sanctions, tried to stop us for putting the tough sanctions in place.
57.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

58.speaker: RYAN:
58.text: Now we have them in place because of Congress. They say the military option's on the table, but it's not being viewed as credible. And the key is to do this peacefully, is to make sure that we have credibility. Under a Romney administration, we will have credibility on this issue.
58.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

59.speaker: RADDATZ:
59.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

60.speaker: BIDEN:
60.text: It's incredible. Look, imagine had we let the Republican Congress work out the sanctions. You think there's any possibility the entire world would have joined us, Russia and China, all of our allies? These are the most crippling sanctions in the history of sanctions, period. Period.
60.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

61.speaker: BIDEN:
61.text: When Governor Romney's asked about it, he said, "We gotta keep these sanctions." When he said, "Well, you're talking about doing more," what are you — you're going to go to war? Is that what you want to do?
61.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

62.speaker: RYAN:
62.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

63.speaker: BIDEN:
63.text: And the interesting thing is, how are they going to prevent war? How are they going to prevent war if they say there's nothing more that we — that they say we should do than what we've already done, number one.
63.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

64.speaker: BIDEN:
64.text: And number two, with regard to the ability of the United States to take action militarily, it is — it is not in my purview to talk about classified information. But we feel quite confident we could deal a serious blow to the Iranians.
64.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

65.speaker: BIDEN:
65.text: But number two, the Iranians are — the Israelis and the United States, our military and intelligence communities are absolutely the same exact place in terms of how close — how close the Iranians are to getting a nuclear weapon. They are a good way away. There is no difference between our view and theirs.
65.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

66.speaker: BIDEN:
66.text: When my friend talks about fissile material, they have to take this highly enriched uranium, get it from 20 percent up, then they have to be able to have something to put it in. There is no weapon that the Iranians have at this point. Both the Israelis and we know — we'll know if they start the process of building a weapon.
66.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

67.speaker: BIDEN:
67.text: So all this bluster I keep hearing, all this loose talk, what are they talking about? Are you talking about, to be more credible — what more can the president do, stand before the United Nations, tell the whole world, directly communicate to the ayatollah, we will not let them acquire a nuclear weapon, period, unless he's talking about going to war.
67.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

68.speaker: RYAN:
68.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

69.speaker: RADDATZ:
69.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

70.speaker: RYAN:
70.text: Let's look at this from the view of the ayatollahs. What do they see? They see this administration trying to water down sanctions in Congress for over two years. They're moving faster toward a nuclear weapon. They're spinning the centrifuges faster.
70.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

71.speaker: RYAN:
71.text: They see us saying when we come into the administration, when they're sworn in, we need more space with our ally, Israel. They see President Obama in New York City the same day Bibi Netanyahu is and he, instead of meeting with him, goes on a — on a daily talk show.
71.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

72.speaker: RYAN:
72.text: They see, when we say that these options are on the table, the secretary of defense walked them back.
72.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

73.speaker: RYAN:
73.text: They are not changing their mind. That's what we have to do, is change their mind so they stop pursuing nuclear weapons, and they're going faster.
73.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

74.speaker: RADDATZ:
74.text: How do you do it so quickly? Look, you — you both saw Benjamin Netanyahu hold up that picture of a bomb with a red line and talking about the red line being in spring. So can you solve this, if the Romney-Ryan ticket is elected, can you solve this in two months before spring and avoid nuclear — nuclear...[
74.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

75.speaker: RYAN:
75.text: We can debate a time line. We can debate the time line, whether there's — it's that short a time or longer. I agree that it's probably longer.
75.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

76.speaker: RYAN:
76.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

77.speaker: RADDATZ:
77.text: You don't agree with that bomb and whether the Israelis...[
77.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

78.speaker: RYAN:
78.text: I don't want to go into classified stuff. But we both agree that to do this peacefully you've got to get them to change their minds. They're not changing their minds. And look at what this administration...
78.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

79.speaker: RADDATZ:
79.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

80.speaker: BIDEN:
80.text: Let me tell you what the ayatollah sees.
80.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

81.speaker: RYAN:
81.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

82.speaker: BIDEN:
82.text: The ayatollah sees his economy being crippled. The ayatollah sees that there are 50 percent fewer exports of oil. He sees the currency going into the tank. He sees the economy going into freefall. And he sees the world for the first time totally united in opposition to him getting a nuclear weapon.
82.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

83.speaker: BIDEN:
83.text: Now, with regard to Bibi, who's been my friend 39 years, the president has met with Bibi a dozen times. He's spoken to Bibi Netanyahu as much as he's spoken to anybody. The idea that we're not — I was in a, just before he went to the U.N., I was in a conference call with the — with the president, with him talking to Bibi for well over an hour, in — in — in stark relief and detail of what was going on.
83.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

84.speaker: BIDEN:
84.text: This is a bunch of stuff. Look, here's the deal.
84.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

85.speaker: RADDATZ:
85.text: What does that mean, a bunch of stuff?
85.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

86.speaker: BIDEN:
86.text: Well, it means it's simply inaccurate.
86.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

87.speaker: RYAN:
87.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

88.speaker: BIDEN:
88.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

89.speaker: BIDEN:
89.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

90.speaker: RADDATZ:
90.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

91.speaker: BIDEN:
91.text: We Irish call it malarkey. But last thing. The secretary of defense has made it absolutely clear, we didn't walk anything back. We will not allow the Iranians to get a nuclear weapon. What Bibi held up there was when they get to the point where they can enrich uranium enough to put into a weapon. They don't have a weapon to put it into.
91.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

92.speaker: BIDEN:
92.text: Let's all calm down a little bit here. Iran is more isolated today than when we took office. It was on the ascendancy when we took office. It is totally isolated.
92.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

93.speaker: RADDATZ:
93.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

94.speaker: BIDEN:
94.text: I don't know what world this guy's living in.
94.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

95.speaker: RYAN:
95.text: Thank heavens we had these sanctions in place. It's in spite of their opposition.
95.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

96.speaker: BIDEN:
96.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

97.speaker: RYAN:
97.text: They've given 20 waivers to this sanction. And all I have to point to are the results. They're four years closer toward a nuclear weapon. I think that case speaks for itself.
97.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

98.speaker: RADDATZ:
98.text: Can you tell the American people...
98.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

99.speaker: BIDEN:
99.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

100.speaker: RADDATZ:
100.text: What's worse, another war in the Middle East...
100.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

101.speaker: BIDEN:
101.text: ... they are not four years closer to a nuclear weapon.
101.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

102.speaker: RYAN:
102.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

103.speaker: BIDEN:
103.text: They're — they're closer to being able to get enough fissile material to put in a weapon if they had a weapon.
103.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

104.speaker: RADDATZ:
104.text: You are acting a little bit like they don't want one.
104.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

105.speaker: BIDEN:
105.text: Oh, I didn't say — no, I'm not saying that. But facts matter, Martha. You're a foreign policy expert. Facts matter. All this loose talk about them, "All they have to do is get to enrich uranium in a certain amount and they have a weapon," not true. Not true.
105.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

106.speaker: BIDEN:
106.text: They are more — and if we ever have to take action, unlike when we took office, we will have the world behind us, and that matters. That matters.
106.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

107.speaker: RADDATZ:
107.text: What about Bob Gates' statement? Let me read that again, "could prove catastrophic, haunting us for generations."
107.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

108.speaker: BIDEN:
108.text: He is right. It could prove catastrophic, if we didn't do it with precision.
108.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

109.speaker: RADDATZ:
109.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

110.speaker: RYAN:
110.text: And what it does is it undermines our credibility by backing up the point when we make it that all options are on the table. That's the point. The ayatollahs see these kinds of statements and they think, "I'm going to get a nuclear weapon."
110.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

111.speaker: RYAN:
111.text: When — when we see the kind of equivocation that took place because this administration wanted a precondition policy, so when the Green Revolution started up, they were silent for nine days. When they see us putting — when they see us putting daylight between ourselves and our allies in Israel, that gives them encouragement. When they see Russia watering down any further sanctions, the only reason we got a U.N. sanction is because Russia watered it down and prevented these central bank sanctions in the first place. So when they see this kind of activity, they are encouraged to continue, and that's the problem.
111.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

112.speaker: BIDEN:
112.text: Martha, let me tell you what Russia...[
112.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

113.speaker: RADDATZ:
113.text: Well, let me ask you what's worse, war in the Middle East, another war in the Middle East, or a nuclear-armed Iran?
113.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

114.speaker: RYAN:
114.text: I'll tell you what's worse. I'll tell you what's worse.
114.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

115.speaker: RADDATZ:
115.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

116.speaker: RYAN:
116.text: A nuclear-armed Iran which triggers a nuclear arms race in the Middle East. This is the world's largest sponsor of — of terrorism. They've dedicated themselves...[
116.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

117.speaker: RADDATZ:
117.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

118.speaker: RYAN:
118.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

119.speaker: BIDEN:
119.text: War should always be the absolute last resort. That's why these crippling sanctions, which Bibi Netanyahu says we should continue, which — if I'm not mistaken — Governor Romney says we — we should continue. I may be mistaken. He changes his mind so often, I could be wrong.
119.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

120.speaker: BIDEN:
120.text: But the fact of the matter is, he says they're working. And the fact is that they are being crippled by them. And we've made it clear, big nations can't bluff. This president doesn't bluff.
120.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

121.speaker: RADDATZ:
121.text: Gentlemen, I want to bring the conversation to a different kind of national security issue, the state of our economy. The number-one issue here at home is jobs. The percentage of unemployed just fell below 8 percent for the first time in 43 months. The Obama administration had projected that it would fall below 6 percent now after the addition of close to a trillion dollars in stimulus money.
121.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

122.speaker: RADDATZ:
122.text: So will both of you level with the American people: Can you get unemployment to under 6 percent and how long will it take?
122.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

123.speaker: BIDEN:
123.text: I don't know how long it will take. We can and we will get it under 6 percent. Let's look at — let's take a look at the facts. Let's look at where we were when we came to office. The economy was in free fall. We had — the great recession hit; 9 million people lost their job; $1.7 — $1.6 trillion in wealth lost in equity in your homes, in retirement accounts for the middle class.
123.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

124.speaker: BIDEN:
124.text: We knew we had to act for the middle class. We immediately went out and rescued General Motors. We went ahead and made sure that we cut taxes for the middle class. And in addition to that, when that — when that occurred, what did Romney do? Romney said, "No, let Detroit go bankrupt." We moved in and helped people refinance their homes. Governor Romney said, "No, let foreclosures hit the bottom."
124.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

125.speaker: BIDEN:
125.text: But it shouldn't be surprising for a guy who says 47 percent of the American people are unwilling to take responsibility for their own lives. My friend recently in a speech in Washington said "30 percent of the American people are takers."
125.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

126.speaker: BIDEN:
126.text: These people are my mom and dad — the people I grew up with, my neighbors. They pay more effective tax than Governor Romney pays in his federal income tax. They are elderly people who in fact are living off of Social Security. They are veterans and people fighting in Afghanistan right now who are, quote, "not paying any tax."
126.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

127.speaker: BIDEN:
127.text: I've had it up to here with this notion that 47 percent — it's about time they take some responsibility here. And instead of signing pledges to Grover Norquist not to ask the wealthiest among us to contribute to bring back the middle class, they should be signing a pledge saying to the middle class we're going to level the playing field; we're going to give you a fair shot again; we are going to not repeat the mistakes we made in the past by having a different set of rules for Wall Street and Main Street, making sure that we continue to hemorrhage these tax cuts for the super wealthy.
127.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

128.speaker: BIDEN:
128.text: They're pushing the continuation of a tax cut that will give an additional $500 billion in tax cuts to 120,000 families. And they're holding hostage the middle class tax cut because they say we won't pass — we won't continue the middle class tax cut unless you give the tax cut for the super wealthy.
128.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

129.speaker: BIDEN:
129.text: It's about time they take some responsibility.
129.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

130.speaker: RADDATZ:
130.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

131.speaker: RYAN:
131.text: Joe and I are from similar towns. He's from Scranton, Pennsylvania. I'm from Janesville, Wisconsin. You know what the unemployment rate in Scranton is today?
131.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

132.speaker: BIDEN:
132.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

133.speaker: RYAN:
133.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

134.speaker: BIDEN:
134.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

135.speaker: RYAN:
135.text: You know what it was the day you guys came in — 8.5 percent.
135.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

136.speaker: BIDEN:
136.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

137.speaker: RYAN:
137.text: That's how it's going all around America.
137.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

138.speaker: RYAN:
138.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

139.speaker: BIDEN:
139.text: You don't read the statistics. That's not how it's going. It's going down.
139.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

140.speaker: RADDATZ:
140.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

141.speaker: RYAN:
141.text: Look, did they come in and inherit a tough situation? Absolutely. But we're going in the wrong direction. Look at where we are. The economy is barely limping along. It's growing a 1.3 percent. That's slower than it grew last year and last year was slower than the year before.
141.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

142.speaker: RYAN:
142.text: Job growth in September was slower than it was in August, and August was slower than it was in July. We're heading in the wrong direction; 23 million Americans are struggling for work today; 15 percent of Americans are living in poverty today. This is not what a real recovery looks like. We need real reforms for real recovery and that's exactly what Mitt Romney and I are proposing. It's a five-point plan. Get America energy independent in North America by the end of the decade. Help people who are hurting get the skills they need to get the jobs they want. Get this deficit and debt under control to prevent a debt crisis.
142.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

143.speaker: RYAN:
143.text: Make trade work for America so we can make more things in America and sell them overseas, and champion small businesses. Don't raise taxes on small businesses because they're our job creators.
143.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

144.speaker: RYAN:
144.text: He talks about Detroit. Mitt Romney's a car guy. They keep misquoting him, but let me tell you about the Mitt Romney I know. This is a guy who I was talking to a family in Northborough, Massachusetts the other day, Sheryl and Mark Nixon. Their kids were hit in a car crash, four of them. Two of them, Rob and Reed, were paralyzed. The Romneys didn't know them. They went to the same church; they never met before.
144.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

145.speaker: RYAN:
145.text: Mitt asked if he could come over on Christmas. He brought his boys, his wife, and gifts. Later on, he said, "I know you're struggling, Mark. Don't worry about their college. I'll pay for it."
145.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

146.speaker: RYAN:
146.text: When Mark told me this story, because, you know what, Mitt Romney doesn't tell these stories. The Nixons told this story. When he told me this story, he said it wasn't the help, the cash help. It's that he gave his time, and he has consistently.
146.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

147.speaker: RYAN:
147.text: This is a man who gave 30 percent of his income to charity, more than the two of us combined. Mitt Romney's a good man. He cares about 100 percent of Americans in this country. And with respect to that quote, I think the vice president very well knows that sometimes the words don't come out of your mouth the right way. [
147.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

148.speaker: BIDEN:
148.text: But I always say what I mean. And so does Romney.
148.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

149.speaker: RYAN:
149.text: We want everybody to succeed. We want to get people out of poverty, in the middle class, onto a life of self-sufficiently. We believe in opportunity and upward mobility. That's what we're going to push for in a Romney administration.
149.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

150.speaker: RADDATZ:
150.text: Vice president? I have a feeling you have a few things to say here.
150.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

151.speaker: BIDEN:
151.text: The idea — if you heard that — that little soliloquy on 47 percent and you think he just made a mistake, then I think you're — I — I think — I got a bridge to sell you.
151.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

152.speaker: BIDEN:
152.text: Look, I don't doubt his personal generosity. And I understand what it's like. When I was a little younger than the congressman, my wife was in an accident, killed my daughter and my wife, and my two sons survived. I have sat in the homes of many people who've gone through what I get through, because the one thing you can give people solace is to know if they know you've been through it, that they can make it. So I don't doubt his personal commitment to individuals. But you know what? I know he had no commitment to the automobile industry. He just — he said, let it go bankrupt, period. Let it drop out. All this talk — we saved a million jobs. Two hundred thousand people are working today.
152.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

153.speaker: BIDEN:
153.text: And I've never met two guys who're more down on America across the board. We're told everything's going bad. There are 5.2 million new jobs, private-sector jobs. We need more, but 5.2 million — if they'd get out of the way, if they'd get out of the way and let us pass the tax cut for the middle class, make it permanent, if they get out of the way and pass the — pass the jobs bill, if they get out of the way and let us allow 14 million people who are struggling to stay in their homes because their mortgages are upside down, but they never missed a mortgage payment, just get out of the way.
153.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

154.speaker: BIDEN:
154.text: Stop talking about how you care about people. Show me something. Show me a policy. Show me a policy where you take responsibility.
154.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

155.speaker: BIDEN:
155.text: And, by the way, they talk about this Great Recession if it fell out of the sky, like, "Oh, my goodness, where did it come from?" It came from this man voting to put two wars on a credit card, to at the same time put a prescription drug benefit on the credit card, a trillion-dollar tax cut for the very wealthy. I was there. I voted against them. I said, no, we can't afford that.
155.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

156.speaker: BIDEN:
156.text: And now, all of a sudden, these guys are so seized with the concern about the debt that they created.
156.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

157.speaker: RADDATZ:
157.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

158.speaker: RYAN:
158.text: Let's not forget that they came in with one-party control. When Barack Obama was elected, his party controlled everything. They had the ability to do everything of their choosing. And look at where we are right now.
158.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

159.speaker: RYAN:
159.text: They passed the stimulus. The idea that we could borrow $831 billion, spend it on all of these special interest groups, and that it would work out just fine, that unemployment would never get to 8 percent — it went up above 8 percent for 43 months. They said that, right now, if we just passed this stimulus, the economy would grow at 4 percent. It's growing at 1.3.
159.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

160.speaker: RADDATZ:
160.text: When could you get it below 6 percent?
160.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

161.speaker: RYAN:
161.text: That's what our entire premise of our pro-growth plan for a stronger middle class is all about: getting the economy growing at 4 percent, creating 12 million jobs over the next four years.
161.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

162.speaker: RYAN:
162.text: Look at just the $90 billion in stimulus. The vice president was in charge of overseeing this. $90 billion in green pork to campaign contributors and special interest groups. There are just at the Department of Energy over 100 criminal investigations that have been launched into just how stimulus...[
162.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

163.speaker: BIDEN:
163.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

164.speaker: RADDATZ:
164.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

165.speaker: BIDEN:
165.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

166.speaker: RYAN:
166.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

167.speaker: BIDEN:
167.text: ... runs an investigative committee, spent months and months and months going into this.
167.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

168.speaker: RYAN:
168.text: This is the — this is the inspector general.
168.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

169.speaker: BIDEN:
169.text: Months and months. They found no evidence of cronyism.
169.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

170.speaker: BIDEN:
170.text: And I love my friend here. I — I'm not allowed to show letters but go on our website, he sent me two letters saying, "By the way, can you send me some stimulus money for companies here in the state of Wisconsin?" We sent millions of dollars. You know...[
170.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

171.speaker: RADDATZ:
171.text: You did ask for stimulus money, correct?
171.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

172.speaker: BIDEN:
172.text: Sure he did. By the way...
172.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

173.speaker: RYAN:
173.text: On two occasions we — we — we advocated for constituents who were applying for grants. That's what we do. We do that for all constituents who are...[
173.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

174.speaker: BIDEN:
174.text: I love that. I love that. This was such a bad program and he writes me a letter saying — writes the Department of Energy a letter saying, "The reason we need this stimulus, it will create growth and jobs." His words. And now he's sitting here looking at me.
174.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

175.speaker: BIDEN:
175.text: And by the way, that program, again, investigated. What the Congress said was it was a model. Less than four-tenths of 1 percent waste or fraud in the program.
175.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

176.speaker: BIDEN:
176.text: And all this talk about cronyism. They investigated and investigated, did not find one single piece of evidence. I wish he would just tell — be a little more candid.
176.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

177.speaker: RYAN:
177.text: Was it a good idea to spend taxpayer dollars on electric cars in Finland, or on windmills in China?
177.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

178.speaker: BIDEN:
178.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

179.speaker: RYAN:
179.text: Was it a good idea to borrow all this money from countries like China and spend it on all these various different interest groups?
179.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

180.speaker: BIDEN:
180.text: Let me tell you what was a good idea. It was a good idea, Moody's and others said that this was exactly what we needed to stop this from going off the cliff. It set the conditions to be able to grow again. We have, in fact, 4 percent of those green jobs didn't go under — went under, didn't work. It's a better batting average than investment bankers have. They have about a 40 percent...
180.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

181.speaker: RYAN:
181.text: Where are the 5 million green jobs that were being...
181.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

182.speaker: RADDATZ:
182.text: I want to move on here to Medicare and entitlements. I think we've gone over this quite enough.
182.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

183.speaker: BIDEN:
183.text: By the way, any letter you send me, I'll entertain.
183.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

184.speaker: RYAN:
184.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

185.speaker: RADDATZ:
185.text: Let's talk about Medicare and entitlements. Both Medicare and Social Security are going broke and taking a larger share of the budget in the process.
185.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

186.speaker: RADDATZ:
186.text: Will benefits for Americans under these programs have to change for the programs to survive?
186.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

187.speaker: RADDATZ:
187.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

188.speaker: RYAN:
188.text: Absolutely. Medicare and Social Security are going bankrupt. These are indisputable facts.
188.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

189.speaker: RYAN:
189.text: Look, when I look at these programs, we've all had tragedies in our lives. I think about what they've done for my own family. My mom and I had my grandmother move in with us who was facing Alzheimer's. Medicare was there for here, just like it's there for my mom right now who is a Florida senior.
189.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

190.speaker: RYAN:
190.text: After my dad died, my mom and I got Social Security survivors benefits, helped me pay for college, it helped her go back to college in her 50s where she started a small business because of the new skills she got. She paid all of her taxes on the promise that these programs would be there for her.
190.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

191.speaker: RYAN:
191.text: We will honor this promise. And the best way to do it is reform it for my generation.
191.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

192.speaker: RYAN:
192.text: You see, if you reform these programs for my generation, people 54 and below, you can guarantee they don't change for people in or near retirement, which is precisely what Mitt Romney and I are proposing.
192.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

193.speaker: RYAN:
193.text: Look what — look what Obamacare does. Obamacare takes $716 billion from Medicare to spend on Obamacare. Even their own chief actuary at Medicare backs this up. He says you can't spend the same dollar twice. You can't claim that this money goes to Medicare and Obamacare.
193.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

194.speaker: RYAN:
194.text: And then they put this new Obamacare board in charge of cutting Medicare each and every year in ways that will lead to denied care for current seniors.
194.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

195.speaker: RYAN:
195.text: This board, by the way, it's 15 people, the president's supposed to appoint them next year. And not one of them even has to have medical training.
195.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

196.speaker: RYAN:
196.text: And Social Security? If we don't shore up Social Security, when we run out of the IOUs, when the program goes bankrupt, a 25 percent across-the-board benefit cut kicks in on current seniors in the middle of their retirement. We're going to stop that from happening.
196.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

197.speaker: RYAN:
197.text: They haven't put a credible solution on the table. He'll tell you about vouchers. He'll say all these things to try and scare people. Here's what we're saying: give younger people, when they become Medicare eligible, guaranteed coverage options that you can't be denied, including traditional Medicare. Choose your plan, and then Medicare subsidizes your premiums, not as much for the wealthy people, more coverage for middle-income people, and total out-of-pocket coverage for the poor and the sick.
197.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

198.speaker: RYAN:
198.text: Choice and competition. We would rather have 50 million future seniors determine how their Medicare is delivered to them instead of 15 bureaucrats deciding what, if, when, where they get it.
198.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

199.speaker: RADDATZ:
199.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

200.speaker: BIDEN:
200.text: You know, I heard that death panel argument from Sarah Palin. It seems every vice presidential debate I hear this kind of stuff about panels.
200.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

201.speaker: BIDEN:
201.text: But let's talk about Medicare. What we did is, we saved $716 billion and put it back, applied it to Medicare. We cut the cost of Medicare. We stopped overpaying insurance companies, doctors and hospitals. The AMA supported what we did. AARP endorsed what we did. And it extends the life of Medicare to 2024. They want to wipe this all out.
201.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

202.speaker: BIDEN:
202.text: It also gave more benefits. Any senior out there, ask yourself: Do you have more benefits today? You do. If you're near the donut hole, you have $800 — $600 more to help your prescription drug costs. You get wellness visits without co-pays. They wipe all of this out, and Medicare goes — becomes insolvent in 2016, number one.
202.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

203.speaker: BIDEN:
203.text: Number two, "guaranteed benefit"? It's a voucher. When they first proposed — when the congressman had his first voucher program, the CBO said it would cost $6,400 a year, Martha, more for every senior, 55 and below, when they got there. He knew that, yet he got all the guys in Congress and women in the Republican Party to vote for it. Governor Romney, knowing that, said, I would sign it, were I there.
203.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

204.speaker: BIDEN:
204.text: Who you believe, the AMA, me, a guy who's fought his whole life for this, or somebody who would actually put in motion a plan that knowingly cut — added $6,400 a year more to the cost of Medicare?
204.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

205.speaker: BIDEN:
205.text: Now they got a new plan: "Trust me, it's not going to cost you any more." Folks, follow your instincts on this one.
205.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

206.speaker: BIDEN:
206.text: And with regard to Social Security, we will not — we will not privatize it. If we had listened to Romney, Governor Romney, and the congressman during the Bush years, imagine where all those seniors would be now if their money had been in the market.
206.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

207.speaker: BIDEN:
207.text: Their ideas are old and their ideas are bad, and they eliminate the guarantee of Medicare.
207.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

208.speaker: RYAN:
208.text: Here's the problem. They got caught with their hands in the cookie jar, turning Medicare into a piggybank for Obamacare. Their own actuary from the administration came to Congress and said one out of six hospitals and nursing homes are going to go out of business as a result of this.
208.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

209.speaker: BIDEN:
209.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

210.speaker: RYAN:
210.text: 7.4 million seniors are projected to lose their current Medicare Advantage coverage they have. That's a $3,200 benefit cut.
210.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

211.speaker: BIDEN:
211.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

212.speaker: RYAN:
212.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

213.speaker: BIDEN:
213.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

214.speaker: RYAN:
214.text: These are from your own actuaries.
214.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

215.speaker: BIDEN:
215.text: More — more — more people signed up for Medicare Advantage after the change.
215.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

216.speaker: RYAN:
216.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

217.speaker: BIDEN:
217.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

218.speaker: RYAN:
218.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

219.speaker: BIDEN:
219.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

220.speaker: RYAN:
220.text: Mr. Vice President, I know you're under a lot of duress to make up for lost ground, but I think people would be better served if we don't keep interrupting each other.
220.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

221.speaker: BIDEN:
221.text: Well, don't take all the four minutes then.
221.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

222.speaker: RYAN:
222.text: Let me just — let me just say this. We are not — we're saying don't change benefits for people 55 and above. They already organized their retirement around these promises. [
222.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

223.speaker: RADDATZ:
223.text: But let — let me ask you this. What — what is your specific plan for seniors who really can't afford to make up the difference in the value of what you call a premium support plan and others call a voucher?
223.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

224.speaker: RYAN:
224.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

225.speaker: RADDATZ:
225.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

226.speaker: RYAN:
226.text: That's what we're saying. So we're saying...
226.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

227.speaker: RADDATZ:
227.text: How do you make that up?
227.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

228.speaker: RYAN:
228.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

229.speaker: RYAN:
229.text: Look, this is a plan — by the way, that $6,400 number, it was misleading then, it's totally inaccurate now. This is a plan that's bipartisan. It's a plan I put together with a prominent Democrat senator from Oregon.
229.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

230.speaker: BIDEN:
230.text: There's not one Democrat who endorses it.
230.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

231.speaker: RYAN:
231.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

232.speaker: BIDEN:
232.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

233.speaker: RYAN:
233.text: Our partner is a Democrat from Oregon.
233.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

234.speaker: BIDEN:
234.text: And he said he does no longer support [
234.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

235.speaker: RYAN:
235.text: We — we — we put it — we put it together with the former Clinton budget director.
235.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

236.speaker: BIDEN:
236.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

237.speaker: RYAN:
237.text: This idea — this idea came from the Clinton commission to save Medicare chaired by Senator John Breaux.
237.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

238.speaker: RYAN:
238.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

239.speaker: BIDEN:
239.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

240.speaker: RYAN:
240.text: If we don't — if we don't fix this problem pretty soon then current seniors get cut. Here's the problem: 10,000 people are retiring every single day in America today and they will for 20 years. That's not a political thing, that's a math thing.
240.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

241.speaker: BIDEN:
241.text: Martha, if we just did one thing, if we just — if they just allowed Medicare to bargain for the cost of drugs like Medicaid can, that would save $156 billion right off the bat.
241.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

242.speaker: RYAN:
242.text: And it would deny seniors choices.
242.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

243.speaker: BIDEN:
243.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

244.speaker: RYAN:
244.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

245.speaker: BIDEN:
245.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

246.speaker: RYAN:
246.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

247.speaker: BIDEN:
247.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

248.speaker: BIDEN:
248.text: Look, folks, all you seniors out there, have you been denied choices? Have you lost Medicare Advantage.
248.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

249.speaker: RYAN:
249.text: Because it's working well right now. [
249.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

250.speaker: BIDEN:
250.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

251.speaker: RADDATZ:
251.text: Vice President Biden, let me ask you, if it could help solve the problem, why not very slowly raise the Medicare eligibility age by two years, as Congressman Ryan suggests?
251.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

252.speaker: BIDEN:
252.text: Look, I was there when we did that with Social Security in 1983. I was one of eight people sitting in the room that included Tip O'Neill negotiating with President Reagan. We all got together and everybody said, as long as everybody's in the deal, everybody's in the deal, and everybody is making some sacrifice, we can find a way.
252.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

253.speaker: BIDEN:
253.text: We made the system solvent to 2033. We will not, though, be part of any voucher plan eliminating — the voucher says, "Mom, when you're — when you're 65, go out there, shop for the best insurance you can get. You're out of Medicare." You can buy back in if you want with this voucher, which will not keep pace — will not keep pace with health care costs. Because if it did keep pace with health care costs, there would be no savings. That's why they go the voucher. They — we will be no part of a voucher program or the privatization of Social Security.
253.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

254.speaker: RYAN:
254.text: A voucher is you go to your mailbox, get a check, and buy something. Nobody's proposing that. Barack Obama four years ago running for president said if you don't have any fresh ideas, use stale tactics to scare voters. If you don't have a good record to run on, paint your opponent as someone people should run from. [
254.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

255.speaker: RADDATZ:
255.text: You were one of the few lawmakers to stand with President Bush when he was seeking to partially privatize Social Security.
255.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

256.speaker: RYAN:
256.text: For younger people. What we said then, and what I've always agreed is let younger Americans have a voluntary choice of making their money work faster for them within the Social Security system.
256.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

257.speaker: BIDEN:
257.text: You saw how well that worked.
257.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

258.speaker: RYAN:
258.text: That's not what Mitt Romney's proposing. What we're saying is no changes for anybody 55 and above.
258.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

259.speaker: BIDEN:
259.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

260.speaker: RYAN:
260.text: And then the kinds of changes we're talking about for younger people like myself is don't increase the benefits for wealthy people as fast as everybody else. Slowly raise the retirement age over time.
260.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

261.speaker: BIDEN:
261.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

262.speaker: RYAN:
262.text: It wouldn't get to the age of 70 until the year 2103 according to the actuaries.
262.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

263.speaker: RYAN:
263.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

264.speaker: RADDATZ:
264.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

265.speaker: BIDEN:
265.text: Quickly. The bottom line here is that all the studies show that if we went with Social Security proposal made by Mitt Romney, if you're 40 — in your 40s now you will pay $2,600 a year — you get $2,600 a year less in Social Security. If you're in your 20s now, you get $4,700 [
265.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

266.speaker: BIDEN:
266.text: The idea of changing, and change being in this case to cut the benefits for people without taking other action you could do to make it work is absolutely the wrong way.
266.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

267.speaker: BIDEN:
267.text: These — look, these guys haven't been big on Medicare from the beginning. Their party's not been big on Medicare from the beginning. And they've always been about Social Security as little as you can do.
267.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

268.speaker: BIDEN:
268.text: Look, folks, use your common sense. Who do you trust on this — a man who introduced a bill that would raise it 40 — $6,400 a year; knowing it and passing it, and Romney saying he'd sign it, or me and the president?
268.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

269.speaker: RYAN:
269.text: That statistic was completely misleading. But more importantly...
269.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

270.speaker: BIDEN:
270.text: That's — there are the facts right...[
270.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

271.speaker: RYAN:
271.text: This is what politicians do when they don't have a record to run on: try to scare people from voting for you. If you don't get ahead of this problem, it's going to...[
271.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

272.speaker: BIDEN:
272.text: Medicare beneficiaries — there are more beneficiaries...[
272.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

273.speaker: RADDATZ:
273.text: We're going to — we're going to move...[
273.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

274.speaker: RYAN:
274.text: We're not going to run away. Medicare and Social Security did so much for my own family. We are not going to jeopardize this program, but we have to save it...[
274.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

275.speaker: BIDEN:
