275.text: You are jeopardizing this program. You're changing the program from a guaranteed benefit to premium support. Whatever you call it, the bottom line is people are going to have to pay more money out of their pocket and the families I know and the families I come from, they don't have the money to pay more out...[
275.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

276.speaker: RYAN:
276.text: That's why we're saying more for lower income people and less for higher income people.
276.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

277.speaker: RADDATZ:
277.text: Gentlemen, I would like to move on to a very simple question for both of you, and something tells me I won't get a very simple answer, but let me ask you this.
277.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

278.speaker: BIDEN:
278.text: I gave you a simple answer. He's raising the cost of Medicare.
278.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

279.speaker: RADDATZ:
279.text: OK, on to taxes. If your ticket is elected, who will pay more in taxes? Who will pay less? And we're starting with Vice President Biden for two minutes.
279.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

280.speaker: BIDEN:
280.text: The middle class will pay less and people making $1 million or more will begin to contribute slightly more. Let me give you one concrete example. The continuation of the Bush tax cuts — we are arguing that the Bush tax cuts for the wealthy should be allowed to expire. Of the Bush tax cuts for the wealthy, $800 million — billion of that goes to people making a minimum of $1 million.
280.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

281.speaker: BIDEN:
281.text: We see no justification in these economic times for those, and they're patriotic Americans. They're not asking for this continued tax cut. They're not suggesting it, but my friends are insisting on it; 120,000 families by continuing that tax cut will get an additional $500 billion in tax relief in the next 10 years and their income is an average of $8 million.
281.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

282.speaker: BIDEN:
282.text: We want to extend permanently the middle-class tax cut for — permanently, from the Bush middle-class tax cut. These guys won't allow us to. You know what they're saying? We say "let's have a vote — let's have a vote on the middle-class tax cut and let's have a vote on the upper tax cut; let's go ahead and vote on it."
282.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

283.speaker: BIDEN:
283.text: They're saying no. They're holding hostage the middle class tax cut to the super wealthy. And on top of that, they've got another tax cut coming that's $5 trillion that all of the studies point out will in fact give another $250 million — yeah, $250,000 a year to those 120,000 families and raise taxes for people who are middle income with a child by $2,000 a year.
283.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

284.speaker: BIDEN:
284.text: This is unconscionable. There is no need for this. The middle class got knocked on their heels. The great recession crushed them. They need some help now. The last people who need help are 120,000 families for another — another $500 billion tax cut over the next 10 years.
284.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

285.speaker: RADDATZ:
285.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

286.speaker: RYAN:
286.text: Our entire premise of these tax reform plans is to grow the economy and create jobs. It's a plan that's estimated to create 7 million jobs. Now, we think that government taking 28 percent of a family and business's income is enough. President Obama thinks that the government ought to be able to take as much as 44.8 percent of a small business's income.
286.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

287.speaker: RYAN:
287.text: Look, if you taxed every person and successful business making over $250,000 at 100 percent, it would only run the government for 98 days. If everybody who paid income taxes last year, including successful small businesses, doubled their income taxes this year, we'd still have a $300 billion deficit. You see? There aren't enough rich people and small businesses to tax to pay for all their spending.
287.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

288.speaker: RYAN:
288.text: And so the next time you hear them say, "Don't worry about it, we'll get a few wealthy people to pay their fair share," watch out, middle class, the tax bill's coming to you.
288.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

289.speaker: RYAN:
289.text: That's why we're saying we need fundamental tax reform. Let's take a look at it this way. Eight out of 10 businesses, they file their taxes as individuals, not as corporations. And where I come from, overseas, which is Lake Superior, the Canadians, they dropped their tax rates to 15 percent. The average tax rate on businesses in the industrialized world is 25 percent, and the president wants the top effective tax rate on successful small businesses to go above 40 percent.
289.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

290.speaker: RYAN:
290.text: Two-thirds of our jobs come from small businesses. This one tax would actually tax about 53 percent of small-business income. It's expected to cost us 710,000 jobs. And you know what? It doesn't even pay for 10 percent of their proposed deficit spending increases.
290.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

291.speaker: RYAN:
291.text: What we are saying is, lower tax rates across the board and close loopholes, primarily to the higher-income people. We have three bottom lines: Don't raise the deficit, don't raise taxes on the middle class, and don't lower the share of income that is borne by the high-income earners.
291.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

292.speaker: RYAN:
292.text: He'll keep saying this $5 trillion plan, I suppose. It's been discredited by six other studies. And even their own deputy campaign manager acknowledged that it wasn't correct.
292.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

293.speaker: RADDATZ:
293.text: Well, let's talk about this 20 percent. You have refused — and, again — to offer specifics on how you pay for that 20 percent across-the-board tax cut. Do you actually have the specifics? Or are you still working on it, and that's why you won't tell voters?
293.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

294.speaker: RYAN:
294.text: Different than this administration, we actually want to have big bipartisan agreements. You see, I understand the...
294.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

295.speaker: RADDATZ:
295.text: Do you have the specifics? Do you have the...[
295.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

296.speaker: BIDEN:
296.text: That would — that would be a first for the Republican Congress.
296.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

297.speaker: RADDATZ:
297.text: Do you know exactly what you're doing?
297.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

298.speaker: RYAN:
298.text: Look — look at what Mitt Romney — look at what Ronald Reagan and Tip O'Neill did. They worked together out of a framework to lower tax rates and broaden the base, and they worked together to fix that.
298.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

299.speaker: RYAN:
299.text: What we're saying is, here's our framework. Lower tax rates 20 percent. We raised about $1.2 trillion through income taxes. We forego about $1.1 trillion in loopholes and deductions. And so what we're saying is, deny those loopholes and deductions to higher-income taxpayers so that more of their income is taxed, which has a broader base of taxation...
299.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

300.speaker: BIDEN:
300.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

301.speaker: RYAN:
301.text: ... so we can lower tax rates across the board. Now, here's why I'm saying this. What we're saying is, here's the framework...
301.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

302.speaker: BIDEN:
302.text: I hope I'm going to get time to respond to this.
302.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

303.speaker: RADDATZ:
303.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

304.speaker: RYAN:
304.text: We want to work with Congress — we want to work with the Congress on how best to achieve this. That means successful. Look...
304.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

305.speaker: RADDATZ:
305.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

306.speaker: RYAN:
306.text: Mitt — what we're saying is, lower tax rates 20 percent, start with the wealthy, work with Congress to do it...
306.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

307.speaker: RADDATZ:
307.text: And you guarantee this math will add up?
307.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

308.speaker: RYAN:
308.text: Absolutely. Six studies have guaranteed — six studies have verified that this math adds up. But here's...
308.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

309.speaker: RADDATZ:
309.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

310.speaker: BIDEN:
310.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

311.speaker: RYAN:
311.text: I'll come back in a second, then, right?
311.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

312.speaker: BIDEN:
312.text: First of all, I was there when Ronald Reagan tax breaks — he gave specifics of what he was going to cut, number one, in terms of tax expenditures. Number two, 97 percent of the small businesses in America pay less — make less than $250,000. Let me tell you who some of those other small businesses are: hedge funds that make $600 million, $800 million a year. That's — that's what they count as small businesses, because they're pass- through.
312.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

313.speaker: BIDEN:
313.text: Let's look at how sincere they are. Ronald — I mean, excuse me, Governor Romney on "60 Minutes" — I guess it was about 10 days ago — was asked, "Governor, you pay 14 percent on $20 million. Someone making $50,000 pays more than that. Do you think that's fair?" He said, "Oh, yes, that's fair. That's fair."
313.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

314.speaker: BIDEN:
314.text: This is — and they're going to talk — you think these guys are going to go out there and cut those loopholes? The loophole — the biggest loophole they take advantage of is the carried interest loophole and — and capital gains loophole. They exempt that.
314.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

315.speaker: BIDEN:
315.text: Now, there's not enough — the reason why the AEI study, the American Enterprise Institute study, the Tax Policy Center study, the reason they all say it's going — taxes go up on the middle class, the only way you can find $5 trillion in loopholes is cut the mortgage deduction for middle-class people, cut the health care deduction, middle-class people, take away their ability to get a tax break to send their kids to college. That's why they arrive at it.
315.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

316.speaker: RADDATZ:
316.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

317.speaker: RYAN:
317.text: He is wrong about that. They're...
317.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

318.speaker: BIDEN:
318.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

319.speaker: RYAN:
319.text: You can — you can cut tax rates by 20 percent and still preserve these important preferences for middle-class taxpayers...
319.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

320.speaker: BIDEN:
320.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

321.speaker: RYAN:
321.text: It is mathematically possible. It's been done before. It's precisely what we're proposing.
321.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

322.speaker: BIDEN:
322.text: It has never been done before.
322.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

323.speaker: RYAN:
323.text: It's been done a couple of times, actually.
323.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

324.speaker: BIDEN:
324.text: It has never been done before.
324.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

325.speaker: RYAN:
325.text: Jack Kennedy lowered tax rates, increased growth. Ronald Reagan...
325.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

326.speaker: BIDEN:
326.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

327.speaker: RYAN:
327.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

328.speaker: BIDEN:
328.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

329.speaker: RYAN:
329.text: Republican and Democrats have worked together on this.
329.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

330.speaker: BIDEN:
330.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

331.speaker: RYAN:
331.text: You know, I understand you guys aren't used to doing bipartisan deals...
331.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

332.speaker: BIDEN:
332.text: But we told each other what we're going to do.
332.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

333.speaker: RYAN:
333.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

334.speaker: BIDEN:
334.text: When we did it Reagan, we said, here — here are the things we're going to cut. [
334.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

335.speaker: RYAN:
335.text: We said here's the framework, let's work together to fill in the details. That's exactly...
335.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

336.speaker: BIDEN:
336.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

337.speaker: RYAN:
337.text: That's how you get things done. You work with Congress — look, let me say it this way. [
337.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

338.speaker: BIDEN:
338.text: That's coming from a Republican Congress working bipartisanly, 7 percent rating? Come on.
338.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

339.speaker: RYAN:
339.text: Mitt Romney was governor of Massachusetts, where 87 percent of the legislators he served, which were Democrats. He didn't demonize them. He didn't demagogue them. He met with those party leaders every week. He reached across the aisle. He didn't compromise principles.
339.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

340.speaker: BIDEN:
340.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

341.speaker: RYAN:
341.text: He found common ground — and he balanced the budget...
341.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

342.speaker: BIDEN:
342.text: You saw — if he did such a great job...
342.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

343.speaker: RADDATZ:
343.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

344.speaker: RYAN:
344.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

345.speaker: BIDEN:
345.text: Why isn't he even contesting Massachusetts? [
345.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

346.speaker: RADDATZ:
346.text: Mr. Vice President, what would you suggest — what would you suggest beyond raising taxes on the wealthy, that would substantially reduce the long-term deficit?
346.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

347.speaker: BIDEN:
347.text: Just let the taxes expire like they're supposed to on those millionaires. We don't — we can't afford $800 billion going to people making a minimum of $1 million. They do not need it, Martha. Those 120,000 families make $8 million a year. Middle-class people need the help. Why does my friend cut out the tuition tax credit for them? Why does he go after the childcare...
347.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

348.speaker: RADDATZ:
348.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

349.speaker: BIDEN:
349.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

350.speaker: RADDATZ:
350.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

351.speaker: RYAN:
351.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

352.speaker: RADDATZ:
352.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

353.speaker: RYAN:
353.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

354.speaker: RADDATZ:
354.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

355.speaker: RYAN:
355.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

356.speaker: BIDEN:
356.text: Can you guarantee that no one making less than $100,000 will have a mortgage — their mortgage deduction impacted? Guarantee?
356.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

357.speaker: RYAN:
357.text: This taxes a million small businesses. He keeps trying to make you think that it's just some movie star or hedge fund guy or an actor...
357.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

358.speaker: BIDEN:
358.text: Ninety-seven percent of the small businesses make less than $250,000 a year, would not be affected.
358.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

359.speaker: RYAN:
359.text: Joe, you know it hits a million — this taxes a million people, a million small businesses.
359.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

360.speaker: BIDEN:
360.text: Does it tax 97 percent of the American businesses?
360.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

361.speaker: RYAN:
361.text: It taxes a million small businesses...
361.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

362.speaker: BIDEN:
362.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

363.speaker: RYAN:
363.text: ... who are our greatest job creators.
363.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

364.speaker: BIDEN:
364.text: I wish I'd get — the "greatest job creators" are the hedge fund guys.
364.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

365.speaker: RADDATZ:
365.text: And you're — and you're going to increase the defense budget.
365.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

366.speaker: RYAN:
366.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

367.speaker: RADDATZ:
367.text: And you're going to increase the defense budget.
367.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

368.speaker: RYAN:
368.text: No, we're not just going to cut the defense budget like they're — they're proposing...
368.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

369.speaker: BIDEN:
369.text: They're going to increase it $2 billion.
369.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

370.speaker: RYAN:
370.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

371.speaker: RADDATZ:
371.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

372.speaker: RYAN:
372.text: No, we're saying don't — OK, you want to get into defense now?
372.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

373.speaker: RADDATZ:
373.text: Yes, I do. I do, because that's another math question.
373.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

374.speaker: RYAN:
374.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

375.speaker: RADDATZ:
375.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

376.speaker: RYAN:
376.text: So they proposed a $478 billion cut to defense to begin with. Now we have another $500 billion cut to defense that's lurking on the horizon. They insisted upon that cut being involved in the debt negotiations, and so we have a $1 trillion cut...
376.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

377.speaker: RADDATZ:
377.text: Let's put the automatic defense cuts aside, OK?
377.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

378.speaker: RYAN:
378.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

379.speaker: RADDATZ:
379.text: Let's put those aside. No one wants that.
379.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

380.speaker: BIDEN:
380.text: I'd like to go back to that.
380.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

381.speaker: RADDATZ:
381.text: But I want to know how you do the math and have this increase in defense spending?
381.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

382.speaker: BIDEN:
382.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

383.speaker: RYAN:
383.text: You don't cut defense by a trillion dollars. That's what we're talking about.
383.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

384.speaker: RADDATZ:
384.text: And what — what national security issues justify an increase?
384.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

385.speaker: BIDEN:
385.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

386.speaker: RYAN:
386.text: We're going to cut 80,000 soldiers, 20,000 Marines, 120 cargo planes. We're going to push the Joint Strike Fighter out...
386.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

387.speaker: RADDATZ:
387.text: Drawing down in one war and one war...
387.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

388.speaker: RYAN:
388.text: If these cuts go through, our Navy will be the smallest — the smallest it has been since before World War I.
388.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

389.speaker: RYAN:
389.text: This invites weakness. Look, do we believe in peace through strength? You bet we do. And that means you don't impose these devastating cuts on our military.
389.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

390.speaker: RYAN:
390.text: So we're saying don't cut the military by a trillion dollars. Not increase it by a trillion, don't cut it by a trillion dollars.
390.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

391.speaker: RADDATZ:
391.text: Quickly, Vice President Biden on this. I want to move on.
391.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

392.speaker: BIDEN:
392.text: Look, we don't cut it. And I might add, this so-called — I know we don't want to use the fancy word "sequester," this automatic cut — that was part of a debt deal that they asked for.
392.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

393.speaker: BIDEN:
393.text: And let me tell you what my friend said at a press conference announcing his support of the deal. He said, and I'm paraphrase, We've been looking for this moment for a long time.
393.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

394.speaker: RYAN:
394.text: Can I tell you what that meant? [
394.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

395.speaker: BIDEN:
395.text: And so the bipartisanship is what he voted for, the automatic cuts in defense if they didn't act.
395.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

396.speaker: BIDEN:
396.text: And beyond that, they asked for another — look, the military says we need a smaller, leaner Army, we need more special forces, we need — we don't need more M1 tanks, what we need is more UAVs.
396.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

397.speaker: RADDATZ:
397.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

398.speaker: BIDEN:
398.text: Not some of the military. That was the decision of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, recommended to us and agreed to by the president. That is a fact.
398.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

399.speaker: RADDATZ:
399.text: Who answers to a civilian leader.
399.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

400.speaker: BIDEN:
400.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

401.speaker: RADDATZ:
401.text: OK. Let's move on to Afghanistan.
401.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

402.speaker: RYAN:
402.text: Can I get into that for a second?
402.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

403.speaker: RADDATZ:
403.text: I'd like to move on to Afghanistan please. And that's one of the biggest expenditures this country has made, in dollars, and more importantly in lives.
403.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

404.speaker: RADDATZ:
404.text: We just passed the sad milestone of losing 2,000 U.S. troops there in this war. More than 50 of them were killed this year by the very Afghan forces we are trying to help.
404.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

405.speaker: RADDATZ:
405.text: Now, we've reached the recruiting goal for Afghan forces, we've degraded Al Qaida. So tell me, why not leave now? What more can we really accomplish? Is it worth more American lives?
405.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

406.speaker: RYAN:
406.text: We don't want to lose the gains we've gotten. We want to make sure that the Taliban does not come back in and give Al Qaida a safe haven.
406.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

407.speaker: RYAN:
407.text: We agree with the administration on their 2014 transition.
407.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

408.speaker: RYAN:
408.text: Look, when I think about Afghanistan, I think about the incredible job that our troops have done. You've been there more than the two of us combined. First time I was there in 2002, it was amazing to me what they were facing. When I went to the Ahgandah [
408.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

409.speaker: RYAN:
409.text: And then to go back there in December, to go throughout Helmand with the Marines, to see what they had accomplished, it's nothing short of amazing.
409.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

410.speaker: RYAN:
410.text: What we don't want to do is lose the gains we've gotten. Now, we've disagreed from time to time on a few issues. We would have more likely taken into accounts the recommendations from our commanders, General Petraeus, Admiral Mullen, on troop levels throughout this year's fighting season. We've been skeptical about negotiations with the Taliban, especially while they're shooting at us.
410.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

411.speaker: RYAN:
411.text: But we want to see the 2014 transition be successful, and that means we want to make sure our commanders have what they need to make sure that it is successful so that this does not once again become a launching pad for terrorists.
411.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

412.speaker: RADDATZ:
412.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

413.speaker: BIDEN:
413.text: Martha, let's keep our eye on the ball. The reason — I've been in and out of Afghanistan and Iraq 20 times. I've been up in the Konar [
413.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

414.speaker: BIDEN:
414.text: The fact is, we went there for one reason: to get those people who killed Americans, Al Qaida. We've decimated Al Qaida central. We have eliminated Osama bin Laden. That was our purpose.
414.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

415.speaker: BIDEN:
415.text: And, in fact, in the meantime, what we said we would do, we would help train the Afghan military. It's their responsibility to take over their own security. That's why with 49 of our allies in Afghanistan, we've agreed on a gradual drawdown so we're out of there by the year 20 — in the year 2014.
415.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

416.speaker: BIDEN:
416.text: My friend and the governor say it's based on conditions, which means it depends. It does not depend for us. It is the responsibility of the Afghans to take care of their own security. We have trained over 315,000, mostly without incident. There have been more than two dozen cases of green-on-blue where Americans have been killed. If we do not — if the measures the military has taken do not take hold, we will not go on joint patrols. We will not train in the field. We'll only train in the — in the Army bases that exist there.
416.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

417.speaker: BIDEN:
417.text: But we are leaving. We are leaving in 2014. Period. And in the process, we're going to be saving over the next 10 years another $800 billion. We've been in this war for over a decade. The primary objective is almost completed. Now, all we're doing is putting the Kabul government in a position to be able to maintain their own security.
417.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

418.speaker: BIDEN:
418.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

419.speaker: RADDATZ:
419.text: What — what conditions could justify staying, Congressman Ryan?
419.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

420.speaker: RYAN:
420.text: We don't want to stay. We want — look, one of my best friends in Janesville, a reservist, is at a forward-operating base in eastern Afghanistan right now. Our wives are best friends. Our daughters are best friends. I want — I want him and all of our troops to come home as soon and safely as possible.
420.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

421.speaker: RYAN:
421.text: We want to make sure that 2014 is successful. That's why we want to make sure that we give our commanders what they say they need to make it successful. We don't want to extend beyond 2014. That's the point we're making. You know, if it was just this, I'd feel like we would — we would be able to call this a success, but it's not. What we are witnessing as we turn on our television screens these days is the absolute unraveling of the Obama foreign policy. Problems are growing at home, but — problems are growing abroad, but jobs aren't growing here at home.
421.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

422.speaker: RADDATZ:
422.text: Let me go back to this. He says we're absolutely leaving in 2014. You're saying that's not an absolute, but you won't talk about what conditions would justify...[
422.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

423.speaker: RYAN:
423.text: Do you know why we say that?
423.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

424.speaker: BIDEN:
424.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

425.speaker: RYAN:
425.text: Because we don't want to broadcast to our enemies "put a date on your calendar, wait us out, and then come back." We want to make sure...[
425.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

426.speaker: RADDATZ:
426.text: But you agree with the timeline.
426.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

427.speaker: RYAN:
427.text: We do agree — we do agree with the timeline and the transition, but what we — what any administration will do in 2013 is assess the situation to see how best to complete this timeline. What we do not want to do...
427.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

428.speaker: BIDEN:
428.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

429.speaker: RYAN:
429.text: ... what we don't want to do is give our allies reason to trust us less and our enemies more — we don't want to embolden our enemies to hold and wait out for us and then take over...[
429.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

430.speaker: BIDEN:
430.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

431.speaker: RYAN:
431.text: That's why we want to make sure — no, that's why we want to make sure that...[
431.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

432.speaker: BIDEN:
432.text: Forty-nine of our allies — hear me — 49 of our allies signed on to this position.
432.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

433.speaker: RYAN:
433.text: And we're reading that they want to...[
433.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

434.speaker: BIDEN:
434.text: Forty-nine — 49 of our allies said "out in 2014." It's the responsibility of the Afghans. We have other responsibilities... [
434.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

435.speaker: RADDATZ:
435.text: Do you really think that this timeline...[
435.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

436.speaker: RYAN:
436.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

437.speaker: RADDATZ:
437.text: We have — we have soldiers and Marines. We have Afghan forces murdering our forces over there. The Taliban is, do you think, taking advantage of this timeline?
437.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

438.speaker: BIDEN:
438.text: Look, the Taliban — what we've found out, and we — you saw it in Iraq, Martha, unless you set a timeline, Baghdad, in the case of Iraq, and — and Kabul, in the case of Afghanistan will not step up. They're happy to let us continue to do the job; international security forces to do the job.
438.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

439.speaker: BIDEN:
439.text: The only way they step up is to say, "Fellas, we're leaving; we've trained you; step up, step up."
439.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

440.speaker: RADDATZ:
440.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

441.speaker: BIDEN:
441.text: That's the only way it works.
441.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

442.speaker: RADDATZ:
442.text: Let me go back to the — the surge troops that we put in there. And — and you brought this up, Congressman Ryan. I have talked to a lot of troops. I've talked to senior offices who were concerned that the surge troops were pulled out during the fighting season, and some of them saw that as a political — as a political move. So can you tell me, Vice President Biden, what was the military reason for bringing those surge troops home...
442.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

443.speaker: BIDEN:
443.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

444.speaker: RADDATZ:
444.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

445.speaker: BIDEN:
445.text: ... was bringing — by the way, when the president announced the surge, you'll remember, Martha, he said the surge will be out by the end of the summer. The military said the surge will be out. Nothing political about this.
445.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

446.speaker: BIDEN:
446.text: Before the surge occurred — so you be a little straight with me here, too — before the surge occurred, we said they'll be out by the end of the summer. That's what the military said. The reason for that is...
446.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

447.speaker: RADDATZ:
447.text: The military follows orders. I mean, there — trust me. There are people who were concerned about pulling out on the fighting season.
447.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

448.speaker: BIDEN:
448.text: Sure. There are people that are concerned, but not the Joint Chiefs. That was their recommendation in the Oval Office to the president of the United States of America. I sat there. I'm sure you'll find someone who disagrees with the Pentagon. I'm positive you'll find that within the military. But that's not the case here.
448.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

449.speaker: BIDEN:
449.text: And, secondly, the reason why the military said that is, you cannot wait and have a cliff. It takes — you know — months and months and months to draw down forces.
449.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

450.speaker: RYAN:
450.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

451.speaker: RYAN:
451.text: Here's the way it works. The mountain passes fill in with snow. The Taliban and the terrorists and the Haqqani and the Quetta Shura come over from Pakistan to fight our men and women. When it fills in with snow, they can't do it. That's what we call fighting seasons. In the warm months, fighting gets really high. In the winter, it goes down.
451.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

452.speaker: RYAN:
452.text: And so when Admiral Mullen and General Petraeus came to Congress and said, if you pull these people out before the fighting season is end, it puts people more at risk. That's the problem.
452.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

453.speaker: RYAN:
453.text: Yes, we drew 22,000 troops down last month, but the remaining troops that are there, who still have the same mission to prosecute counterinsurgency, are doing it with fewer people. That makes them less safe.
453.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

454.speaker: BIDEN:
454.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

455.speaker: RYAN:
455.text: We're sending fewer people out in all of these hotspots to do the same job that they were supposed to do a month ago.
455.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

456.speaker: BIDEN:
456.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

457.speaker: RYAN:
457.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

458.speaker: BIDEN:
458.text: ... we turned it over to the Afghan troops we trained. No one got pulled out that didn't get filled in by trained Afghan personnel. And he's — he's conflating two issues. The fighting season that Petraeus was talking about and former — and Admiral Mullen was the fighting season this spring. That's what he was talking about. We did not — we did not pull them out.
458.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

459.speaker: RYAN:
459.text: The calendar works the same every year.
459.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

460.speaker: BIDEN:
460.text: It does work the same every year. But we're not staying there...
460.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

461.speaker: RYAN:
461.text: Spring, summer, fall. It's warm, or it's not. They're still fighting us. They're still coming over the passes. They're still coming into Zabul, to Kunar, to all of these areas, but we are sending fewer people to the front to fight them. And that's...[
461.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

462.speaker: BIDEN:
462.text: That's right, because that's the Afghan responsibility. We've trained them.
462.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

463.speaker: RYAN:
463.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

464.speaker: RADDATZ:
464.text: Let's move — let's move to another war.
464.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

465.speaker: BIDEN:
465.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

466.speaker: RYAN:
466.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

467.speaker: BIDEN:
467.text: R.C. East is the most dangerous place in the world.
467.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

468.speaker: RYAN:
468.text: That's right. That's why we don't want to send fewer people to the...
468.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

469.speaker: BIDEN:
469.text: That's — that's why we should send Americans in to do the job, instead of the — you'd rather Americans be going in doing the job instead of the trainees?
469.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

470.speaker: RYAN:
470.text: No. We are already sending Americans to do the job, but fewer of them. That's the whole problem.
470.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

471.speaker: BIDEN:
471.text: That's right. We're sending in more Afghans to do the job, Afghans to do the job.
471.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

472.speaker: RADDATZ:
472.text: Let's move to another war, the civil war in Syria, where there are estimates that more — estimates that more than 25,000, 30,000 people have now been killed. In March of last year, President Obama explained the military action taken in Libya by saying it was in the national interest to go in and prevent further massacres from occurring there. So why doesn't the same logic apply in Syria? Vice President Biden?
472.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

473.speaker: BIDEN:
473.text: Different country. It's a different country. It is five times as large geographically, it has one-fifth the population, that is Libya, one-fifth the population, five times as large geographically.
473.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

474.speaker: BIDEN:
474.text: It's in a part of the world where they're not going to see whatever would come from that war. It seep into a regional war.
474.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

475.speaker: BIDEN:
475.text: You're in a country that is heavily populated in the midst of the most dangerous area in the world. And, in fact, if in fact it blows up and the wrong people gain control, it's going to have impact on the entire region causing potentially regional wars.
475.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

476.speaker: BIDEN:
476.text: We are working hand and glove with the Turks, with the Jordanians, with the Saudis, and with all the people in the region attempting to identify the people who deserve the help so that when Assad goes — and he will go — there will be a legitimate government that follows on, not an Al Qaida-sponsored government that follows on.
476.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

477.speaker: BIDEN:
477.text: And all this loose talk of my friend, Governor Romney, and the congressman, about how we're going to do, we could do so much more in there, what more would they do other than put American boots on the ground?
477.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

478.speaker: BIDEN:
478.text: The last thing America needs is to get in another ground war in the Middle East, requiring tens of thousands, if not well over 100,000 American forces. That — they are the facts. They are the facts.
478.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

479.speaker: BIDEN:
479.text: Now, every time the governor is asked about this, he doesn't say anything. He — he goes up with a whole lot of verbiage, but when he gets pressed he says, no, he would not do anything different than we are doing now.
479.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

480.speaker: BIDEN:
480.text: Are they proposing putting American troops on the ground? Putting American aircraft in the airspace? Is that what they're proposing? If they do, they should speak up and say so, but that's not what they're saying.
480.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

481.speaker: BIDEN:
481.text: We are doing it exactly like we need to do to identify those forces who, in fact, will provide for a stable government and not cause a regional Sunni-Shia war when Bassad — when Bashar Assad falls.
481.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

482.speaker: RADDATZ:
482.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

483.speaker: RYAN:
483.text: Nobody is proposing to send troops to Syria. American troops.
483.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

484.speaker: RYAN:
484.text: Now, let me say it this way. How would we do things differently? We wouldn't refer to Bashar Assad as a reformer when he's killing his own civilians with his Russian-provided weapons. We wouldn't be outsourcing our foreign policy to the United Nations giving Vladimir Putin veto power over our efforts to try and deal with this issue. He's vetoed three of them.
484.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

485.speaker: RYAN:
485.text: Hillary Clinton went to Russia to try and convince them not to do so. They thwarted her efforts. She said they were on the wrong side of history. She was right about that. This is just one more example of how the Russia reset's not working.
485.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

486.speaker: RYAN:
486.text: And so where are we? After international pressure mounted, the President Obama said Bashar Assad should go. It's been over a year. The man has slaughtered tens of thousands of his own people. And more foreign fighters are spilling into this country.
486.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

487.speaker: RYAN:
487.text: So the longer this has gone on, the more people, groups like Al Qaida are going in. We could have more easily identified the free Syrian army, the freedom fighters, working with our allies, the Turks, the Qataris, the Saudis, had we had a better plan in place to begin with working through our allies. But, no, we waited for Kofi Annan to try and come up with an agreement through the U.N. That bought Bashar Assad time.
487.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

488.speaker: RYAN:
488.text: We gave Russia veto power over our efforts through the U.N. And meanwhile about 30,000 Syrians are dead.
488.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

489.speaker: BIDEN:
489.text: What would my friend do differently? If you notice, he never answers the question.
489.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

490.speaker: RYAN:
490.text: No, I would — I — we would not be going through the U.N. in all of these things.
490.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

491.speaker: BIDEN:
491.text: Let me — you don't go through the U.N. We are in the process now — and have been for months — in making sure that help, humanitarian aid, as well as other aid and training is getting to those forces that we believe, the Turks believe, the Jordanians believe, the Saudis believe are the free forces inside of Syria. That is underway.
491.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

492.speaker: BIDEN:
492.text: Our allies were all on the same page, NATO, as well as our Arab allies, in terms of trying to get a settlement. That was their idea. We're the ones that said, "Enough." With regard to the reset not working, the fact of the matter is that Russia has a different interest in Syria than we do, and that's not in our interest.
492.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

493.speaker: RADDATZ:
493.text: What happens if Assad does not fall, Congressman Ryan? What happens to the region? What happens if he hangs on? What happens if he does?
493.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

494.speaker: RYAN:
494.text: Then Iran keeps their greatest ally in the region. He's a sponsor of terrorism. He'll probably continue slaughtering his people. We and the world community will lose our credibility on this. Look, he mentioned the reset...
494.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

495.speaker: RADDATZ:
495.text: So what would Romney-Ryan do about that credibility?
495.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

496.speaker: RYAN:
496.text: Well, we agree with the same red line, actually, they do on chemical weapons, but not putting American troops in, other than to secure those chemical weapons. They're right about that.
496.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

497.speaker: RYAN:
497.text: But what we should have done earlier is work with those freedom fighters, those dissidents in Syria. We should not have called Bashar Assad a reformer. And...
497.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

498.speaker: RADDATZ:
498.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

499.speaker: RYAN:
499.text: ... we should not have — we should not have waited to Russia...
499.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

500.speaker: RADDATZ:
500.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

501.speaker: RYAN:
501.text: ... should not have waited for Russia to give us the green light at the U.N. to do something about it.
501.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

502.speaker: BIDEN:
502.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

503.speaker: RYAN:
503.text: They're — they're still arming the man. Iran is flying flights over Iraq...
503.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

504.speaker: BIDEN:
504.text: And the opposition is being armed.
504.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

505.speaker: RYAN:
505.text: ... to help Bashar Assad. And, by the way, if we had the status-of-forces agreement that the vice president said he would bet his vice presidency on in Iraq, we probably would have been able to prevent that. But he failed to achieve that, as well, again.
505.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

506.speaker: RADDATZ:
506.text: Let me ask you a quick question.
506.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

507.speaker: BIDEN:
507.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

508.speaker: RADDATZ:
508.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

509.speaker: BIDEN:
509.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

510.speaker: RYAN:
510.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

511.speaker: RADDATZ:
511.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

512.speaker: RYAN:
512.text: What is in the national interests of the American people.
512.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

513.speaker: RADDATZ:
513.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

514.speaker: RYAN:
514.text: What is in the national security of the American people. It's got to be in the strategic national interests of our country.
514.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

515.speaker: RADDATZ:
515.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

516.speaker: RYAN:
516.text: Each situation will — will come up with its own set of circumstances, but putting American troops on the ground? That's got to be within the national security interests of the American people.
516.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

517.speaker: RADDATZ:
517.text: I want to — we're — we're almost out of time here.
517.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

518.speaker: RYAN:
518.text: That means like embargoes and sanctions and overflights, those are things that don't put American troops on the ground. But if you're talking about putting American troops on the ground, only in our national security interests.
518.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

519.speaker: RADDATZ:
519.text: I want to move on, and I want to return home for these last few questions. This debate is, indeed, historic. We have two Catholic candidates, first time, on a stage such as this. And I would like to ask you both to tell me what role your religion has played in your own personal views on abortion.
519.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

520.speaker: RADDATZ:
520.text: Please talk about how you came to that decision. Talk about how your religion played a part in that. And, please, this is such an emotional issue for so many people in this country...
520.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

521.speaker: RYAN:
521.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

522.speaker: RADDATZ:
522.text: ... please talk personally about this, if you could.
522.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

523.speaker: RADDATZ:
523.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

524.speaker: RYAN:
524.text: I don't see how a person can separate their public life from their private life or from their faith. Our faith informs us in everything we do. My faith informs me about how to take care of the vulnerable, of how to make sure that people have a chance in life.
524.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

525.speaker: RYAN:
525.text: Now, you want to ask basically why I'm pro-life? It's not simply because of my Catholic faith. That's a factor, of course. But it's also because of reason and science.
525.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

526.speaker: RYAN:
526.text: You know, I think about 10 1/2 years ago, my wife Janna and I went to Mercy Hospital in Janesville where I was born, for our seven week ultrasound for our firstborn child, and we saw that heartbeat. A little baby was in the shape of a bean. And to this day, we have nicknamed our firstborn child Liza, "Bean." Now I believe that life begins at conception.
526.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

527.speaker: RYAN:
527.text: That's why — those are the reasons why I'm pro-life. Now I understand this is a difficult issue, and I respect people who don't agree with me on this, but the policy of a Romney administration will be to oppose abortions with the exceptions for rape, incest and life of the mother. What troubles me more is how this administration has handled all of these issues. Look at what they're doing through Obamacare with respect to assaulting the religious liberties of this country. They're infringing upon our first freedom, the freedom of religion, by infringing on Catholic charities, Catholic churches, Catholic hospitals.
527.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

528.speaker: RYAN:
528.text: Our church should not have to sue our federal government to maintain their religious liberties. And with respect to abortion, the Democratic Party used to say they wanted it to be safe, legal and rare. Now they support it without restriction and with taxpayer funding. Taxpayer funding in Obamacare, taxpayer funding with foreign aid. The vice president himself went to China and said that he sympathized and wouldn't second guess their one child policy of forced abortions and sterilizations. That to me is pretty extreme.
528.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

529.speaker: RADDATZ:
529.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

530.speaker: BIDEN:
530.text: My religion defines who I am, and I've been a practicing Catholic my whole life. And has particularly informed my social doctrine. The Catholic social doctrine talks about taking care of those who — who can't take care of themselves, people who need help. With regard to — with regard to abortion, I accept my church's position on abortion as a — what we call a [
530.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

531.speaker: BIDEN:
531.text: But I refuse to impose it on equally devout Christians and Muslims and Jews, and I just refuse to impose that on others, unlike my friend here, the — the congressman. I — I do not believe that we have a right to tell other people that — women they can't control their body. It's a decision between them and their doctor. In my view and the Supreme Court, I'm not going to interfere with that. With regard to the assault on the Catholic church, let me make it absolutely clear, no religious institution, Catholic or otherwise, including Catholic Social Services, Georgetown Hospital, Mercy Hospital, any hospital, none has to either refer contraception, none has to pay for contraception, none has to be a vehicle to get contraception in any insurance policy they provide. That is a fact.
531.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

532.speaker: BIDEN:
532.text: That is a fact. Now with regard to the way in which the — we differ, my friend says that he — well I guess he accepts Governor Romney's position now, because in the past he has argued that there was — there's rape and forcible rape. He's argued that in the case of rape or incest, it was still — it would be a crime to engage in having an abortion. I just fundamentally disagree with my friend.
532.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

533.speaker: RADDATZ:
533.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

534.speaker: RYAN:
534.text: All I'm saying is, if you believe that life begins at conception, that, therefore, doesn't change the definition of life. That's a principle. The policy of a Romney administration is to oppose abortion with exceptions for rape, incest and life of the mother.
534.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

535.speaker: RYAN:
535.text: Now, I've got to take issue with the Catholic church and religious liberty.
535.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

536.speaker: BIDEN:
536.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

537.speaker: BIDEN:
537.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

538.speaker: RYAN:
538.text: ... why would they keep — why would they keep suing you? It's a distinction without a difference.
538.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

539.speaker: RADDATZ:
539.text: I want to go back to the abortion question here. If the Romney-Ryan ticket is elected, should those who believe that abortion should remain legal be worried?
539.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

540.speaker: RYAN:
540.text: We don't think that unelected judges should make this decision; that people through their elected representatives in reaching a consensus in society through the democratic process should make this determination.
540.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

541.speaker: BIDEN:
541.text: The court — the next president will get one or two Supreme Court nominees. That's how close Roe v. Wade is. Just ask yourself, with Robert Bork being the chief adviser on the court for — for Mr. Romney, who do you think he's likely to appoint? Do you think he's likely to appoint someone like Scalia or someone else on the court far right that would outlaw [
541.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

542.speaker: BIDEN:
542.text: I guarantee you, that will not happen. We picked two people. We pick people who are open-minded. They've been good justices. So keep an eye on the Supreme Court...
542.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

543.speaker: RYAN:
543.text: Was there a litmus test on them?
543.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

544.speaker: BIDEN:
544.text: There was no litmus test. We picked people who had an open mind; did not come with an agenda.
544.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

545.speaker: RADDATZ:
545.text: I'm — I'm going to move on to this closing question because we are running out of time.
545.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

546.speaker: RADDATZ:
546.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

547.speaker: RADDATZ:
547.text: I recently spoke to a highly decorated soldier who said that this presidential campaign has left him dismayed. He told me, quote, "the ads are so negative and they are all tearing down each other rather than building up the country."
547.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

548.speaker: RADDATZ:
548.text: What would you say to that American hero about this campaign? And at the end of the day, are you ever embarrassed by the tone?
548.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

549.speaker: RADDATZ:
549.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

550.speaker: BIDEN:
550.text: I would say to him the same thing I say to my son who did serve a year in Iraq, that we only have one truly sacred obligation as a government. That's to equip those we send into harm's way and care for those who come home. That's the only sacred obligation we have. Everything else falls behind that.
550.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

551.speaker: BIDEN:
551.text: I would also tell him that the fact that he, this decorated soldier you talked about, fought for his country, that that should be honored. He should not be thrown into a category of a 47 percent who don't pay their taxes while he was out there fighting and not having to pay taxes, and somehow not taking responsibility.
551.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

552.speaker: BIDEN:
552.text: I would also tell him that there are things that have occurred in this campaign and occur in every campaign that I'm sure both of us regret anyone having said, particularly in these — these special new groups that can go out there, raise all the money they want, not have to identify themselves, who say the most scurrilous things about the other candidate. It's — it's an abomination.
552.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

553.speaker: BIDEN:
553.text: But the bottom line here is I'd ask that hero you referenced to take a look at whether or not Governor Romney or President Obama has the conviction to help lift up the middle class, restore them to where they were before this great recession hit and they got wiped out. Or whether or not he's going to continue to focus on taking care of only the very wealthy, not asking them to make — pay any part of the deal to bring — bring back the middle class and the economy of this country.
553.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

554.speaker: BIDEN:
554.text: I'd ask him to take a look at whether the president of the United States has acted wisely in the use of force and whether or not the slipshod comments being made by my — my — or by Governor Romney serve — serve our interests very well.
554.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

555.speaker: BIDEN:
555.text: But there are things that have been said in campaigns that I — I find not very appealing.
555.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

556.speaker: RADDATZ:
556.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

557.speaker: RYAN:
557.text: First of all, I'd thank him to his service to our country.
557.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

558.speaker: RYAN:
558.text: Second of all, I'd say we are not going to impose these devastating cuts on our military which compromises their mission and their safety.
558.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

559.speaker: RYAN:
559.text: And then I would say, you have a president who ran for president four years ago promising hope and change, who has now turned his campaign into attack, blame and defame.
559.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

560.speaker: RYAN:
560.text: You see, if you don't have a good record to run on, then you paint your opponent as someone to run from. That was what President Obama said in 2008. It's what he's doing right now.
560.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

561.speaker: RYAN:
561.text: Look at all the string of broken promises. If you like your health care plan, you can keep it. Try telling that to the 20 million people who are projected to lose their health insurance if Obamacare goes through or the 7-point million — 7.4 million seniors who are going to lose it.
561.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

562.speaker: RYAN:
562.text: Or remember when he said this: I guarantee if you make less than $250,000, your taxes won't go up. Of the 21 tax increases in Obamacare, 12 of them hit the middle class.
562.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

563.speaker: RYAN:
563.text: Or remember when he said health insurance premiums will go down $2,500 per family, per year? They've gone up $3,000, and they're expected to go up another $2,400.
563.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

564.speaker: RYAN:
564.text: Or remember when he said, "I promise by the end of my first term I'll cut the deficit in half in four years"? We've had four budgets, four trillion-dollar deficits.
564.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

565.speaker: RYAN:
565.text: A debt crisis is coming. We can't keep spending and borrowing like this. We can't keep spending money we don't have.
565.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

566.speaker: RYAN:
566.text: Leaders run to problem to fix problems. President Obama has not even put a credible plan on the table in any of his four years to deal with this debt crisis. I passed two budgets to deal with this. Mitt Romney's put ideas on the table.
566.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

567.speaker: RYAN:
567.text: We've got to tackle this debt crisis before it tackles us. The president likes to say he has a plan. He gave a speech. We asked his budget office, "Can we see the plan?" They sent us to the press secretary. He gave us a copy of the speech. We asked the Congressional Budget Office, "Tell us what President Obama's plan is to prevent a debt crisis." They said, "It's a speech, we can't estimate speeches."
567.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

568.speaker: RYAN:
568.text: You see, that's what we get in this administration — speeches — but we're not getting leadership.
568.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

569.speaker: RYAN:
569.text: Mitt Romney is uniquely qualified to fix these problems. His lifetime of experience, his proven track record of bipartisanship.
569.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

570.speaker: RYAN:
570.text: And what do we have from the president? He broke his big promise to bring people together to solve the country's biggest problems.
570.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

571.speaker: RYAN:
571.text: And what I would tell him is we don't have to settle for this.
571.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

572.speaker: BIDEN:
