572.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

573.speaker: RYAN:
573.text: We can do better than this.
573.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

574.speaker: BIDEN:
574.text: I hope I'll get equal time.
574.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

575.speaker: RADDATZ:
575.text: You will get just a few minutes here. A few seconds, really.
575.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

576.speaker: BIDEN:
576.text: The two budgets the congressman introduced have eviscerated all the things that the middle class cares about. It is [
576.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

577.speaker: BIDEN:
577.text: It does — it does virtually nothing except continue to increase the tax cuts for the very wealthy. And, you know, we've had enough of this.
577.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

578.speaker: BIDEN:
578.text: The idea that he's so concerned about these deficits, I've pointed out he voted to put two wars on a credit card. He did...
578.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

579.speaker: RADDATZ:
579.text: We're going to — we're going to the closing statements in a minute. [
579.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

580.speaker: RYAN:
580.text: Not raising taxes is not cutting taxes. And by the way, our budget...
580.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

581.speaker: BIDEN:
581.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

582.speaker: RYAN:
582.text: ... by 3 percent a year instead of 4.5 percent like they propose. Not spending more money as much as they say is not a spending cut.
582.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

583.speaker: RADDATZ:
583.text: Let me — let me calm down things here just for a minute. And I want to talk to you very briefly before we go to closing statements about your own personal character. If you are elected, what could you both give to this country as a man, as a human being, that no one else could?
583.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

584.speaker: RYAN:
584.text: Honesty, no one else could? There are plenty of fine people who could lead this country. But what you need are people who, when they say they're going to do something, they go do it. What you need are, when people see problems, they offer solutions to fix those problems. We're not getting that.
584.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

585.speaker: RYAN:
585.text: Look, we can grow this economy faster. That's what our five- point plan for a stronger middle class is all about. It's about getting 12 million jobs, higher take-home pay, getting people out of poverty into the middle class. That means going with proven, pro- growth policies that we know works to get people back to work. Putting ideas on the table, working with Democrats — that actually works sometimes — and then...[
585.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

586.speaker: RADDATZ:
586.text: Vice President, can we get to that — to that issue of what you could bring as a man, a human being? And I really — I'm going to keep you to about 15 seconds here.
586.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

587.speaker: BIDEN:
587.text: Well, he gets 40, I get 15, that's OK.
587.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

588.speaker: RADDATZ:
588.text: He didn't have 40. He didn't have 40.
588.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

589.speaker: BIDEN:
589.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

590.speaker: BIDEN:
590.text: Let me tell you. I — my — my record stands for itself. I never say anything I don't mean. Everybody knows, whatever I say, I do. And my whole life has been devoted to leveling the playing field for middle-class people, giving them an even break, treating Main Street and Wall Street the same, hold them to the same responsibility.
590.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

591.speaker: BIDEN:
591.text: Look at my record. It's been all about the middle class. They're the people who grow this country. We think you grow this country from the middle out, not from the top down.
591.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

592.speaker: RADDATZ:
592.text: OK, we now turn to the candidates for their closing statements. Thank you, gentlemen. And that coin toss, again, has Vice President Biden starting with the closing statement.
592.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

593.speaker: BIDEN:
593.text: Well, let — let me say at the outset that I want to thank you, Martha, for doing this, and Centre College. The fact is that we're in a situation where we inherited a god-awful circumstance. People are in real trouble. We acted to move to bring relief to the people who need the most help now.
593.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

594.speaker: BIDEN:
594.text: And — and in the process, we — in case you haven't noticed, we have strong disagreements, but I — you probably detected my frustration with their attitude about the American people. My friend says that 30 percent of the American people are takers. Romney points out 47 percent of the people won't take responsibility.
594.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

595.speaker: BIDEN:
595.text: He's talking about my mother and father. He's talking about the places I grew up in, my neighbors in Scranton and Claymont, and he's talking about — he's talking about the people that have built this country. All they're looking for, Martha, all they're looking for is an even shot. Whenever you give them the shot, they've done it. They've done it. Whenever you've leveled the playing field, they've been able to move. And they want a little bit of peace of mind.
595.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

596.speaker: BIDEN:
596.text: And the president and I are not going to rest until that playing field is leveled, they, in fact, have a clear shot, and they have peace of mind, until they can turn to their kid and say with a degree of confidence, "Honey, it's going to be OK. It's going to be OK." That's what this is all about.
596.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

597.speaker: RADDATZ:
597.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

598.speaker: RYAN:
598.text: I want to thank you, as well, Martha, Danville, Kentucky, Centre College, and I want to thank you, Joe. It's been an honor to engage in this critical debate.
598.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

599.speaker: RYAN:
599.text: We face a very big choice. What kind of country are we going to be? What kind of country are we going to give our kids? President Obama, he had his chance. He made his choices. His economic agenda, more spending, more borrowing, higher taxes, a government takeover of health care. It's not working. It's failed to create the jobs we need.
599.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

600.speaker: RYAN:
600.text: Twenty-three million Americans are struggling for work today. Fifteen percent of Americans are in poverty. This is not what a real recovery looks like. You deserve better. Mitt Romney and I want to earn your support. We're offering real reforms for a real recovery for every American.
600.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

601.speaker: RYAN:
601.text: Mitt Romney — his experience, his ideas, his solutions — is uniquely qualified to get this job done. At a time when we have a jobs crisis in America, wouldn't it be nice to have a job-creator in the White House?
601.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

602.speaker: RYAN:
602.text: The choice is clear: a stagnant economy that promotes more government dependency or a dynamic, growing economy that promotes opportunity and jobs. Mitt Romney and I will not duck the tough issues, and we will not blame others for the next four years. We will take responsibility. And we will not try to replace our founding principles. We will reapply our founding principles.
602.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

603.speaker: RYAN:
603.text: The choice is clear, and the choice rests with you. And we ask you for your vote. Thank you.
603.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

604.speaker: RADDATZ:
604.text: And thank you both again. Thank you very much.
604.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

605.speaker: BIDEN:
605.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky

606.speaker: RADDATZ:
606.text: This concludes the vice presidential debate. Please tune in next Tuesday for the second presidential debate at Hofstra University in New York. I'm Martha Raddatz of ABC News. I do hope all of you go to the polls. Have a good evening. [
606.title: Presidential Candidates Debates: Vice Presidential Debate at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky
